text: my name's lavonda perkins i am the tech
college learning program manager
for the cloud and cyber disciplines in
this role i managed
learning strategies for cloud and cyber
for all associates at capital one
in 2015 capital one cio rob alexander
declared at re invent that capital one
would be all in on the cloud
since that time capital one has made
massive transformation
in the way that we work so we can
continue changing banking for good
for our customers capital one associates
had to also
adapt a new mindset in order to go along
with this change
tech college was founded in 2017 to
provide technical education resources
to our associates at capital one this
year we set a goal to have 30 percent of
our engineers
certified i'm happy to announce that
today we have reached that goal
we accomplished the goal of having 1100
software engineers
certified in just one calendar year and
we're working to our next goal of having
of our engineers certified by end of
calendar year for 2021.
we shared our ambitious goal with aws
and formed an even stronger partnership
we started
by sourcing our peer-to-peer learning
community also known as our gosu
community
gosu is a korean term translating to
meade highly skilled
we depended on our gosu to help us
create training
lead study groups as well as mentor
associates who were looking to get aws
certified
we made sure to provide all types of
training because as you know
not all adult learners learn the same
way some learners prefer instructor-led
training
while others prefer self-paced after
solidifying the plan
we shared the plan with our leadership
team leadership
buy-in is crucial when creating a plan
because your leaders can help
with communicating the plan we had
several associates go on to get
certified and we made sure that those
associates were recognized
after our associates report to us that
they have their
certification we send them an email
along with their manager copied
and we're also recognizing associates in
internal newsletters
for those who've become certified as a
result
of creating our training plan we have
seen an
increase of over 20 percent of our aws
certifications year-to-date by using our
community-based learning approach
through this approach we've seen
associates take on new roles
within the company as well as lead study
groups and mentor other associates
our associates have felt empowered to be
thought leaders
and knowledge leaders within this space
we have found that an increase in aws
certifications
has led to an improvement of over tech
landscape and quality
resiliency and velocity here are some
tips that i have for organizations who
are looking to increase
their aws certifications number one
create a plan be sure in this plan to
include what you want to do
how you're going to do it and why it
should be important to your organization
the next is leader buying if your
leaders have communicated this plan
and their imperatives your communication
and marketing plan will be much
easier to implement the third make sure
you get your associates involved
creating a ecosystem of learning and
giving back
will help not only empower your
associates but it will also increase
your certification numbers because
associates feel valued and important
last but not least recognize your
associates
getting your aws certification is no
easy feat
you need to make sure that your
associates know that their time and
dedication towards aws certifications
is important and that you value them
capital one
closed out their latest data center this
year which means
we'll continue being the main
cheerleaders for our associates
to continue getting aws certified so
everyone can be on the same page
when it comes to being all in on the
cloud so we can continue
changing banking for good for our
customers
